detaileddescription.para:
Another public constructor, getting only the ID.
id
The message ID of the message.
a Message ready to send, with no Data. Can be fill up later.

Constructor of a new message passing an ID and the data as parameters.
id
: the message ID of the message
data
: The data contained in the message
a Message ready to send.

memberdef.argsstring: (MessageID id, uint8_t byte0, uint8_t byte1, uint8_t byte2, uint8_t byte3)
memberdef.name: newMessage

detaileddescription.para:
Another public constructor, getting four bytes as parameters, and the ID. Ensure you to construct a 6 bytes Message.
id
The message ID.
byte0
The first byte of you data.
byte1
The second one.
byte2
The third one.
byte3
The fourth one.
A message ready to send, only on 6 bytes.

A constructor to create a message containing a vector of data. Ensure that the vector is encoded on 4 bytes.
id
The message ID
vectorE
The vector containing the data you want to send.
A message ready to send, containing the data of the vector.

Returns the ID of a message. Useful to read the information got from the sender.
message
A message to read.
The message ID.

Extract a 4 bytes data from the message.
message
The message to read
FourBytes, the data to use, encoded on 4 bytes.

Extract an int32_t data (aka a 4 bytes data but encoded all in once).
message
The message to read
int32_t, the data to use in one unique variable.

Does the same as above, but useful when the message is send with a Vector.
message
The message to read
The vector contained in the message.

Extract the order contained in the message. Uses all the functions above.
message
The message to read containing an order.
Actuator_Order the order to send to actuators.
